result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek R Goral was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs (Heroin), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work and treatment. Court does not object to Electronic monitoring and the Day Reporting Center. Credit for 95 days time served.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence
MUST provide a DNA sample; pay surcharge. Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision and DNA fees due on or before 4-3-16. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms or weapons. Defendant shall not vote until civil rights are restored.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

COURT ORDERED Defendant to serve 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction / Day Reporting Center, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 95 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work and treatment.

COURT ORDERED THE FOLLOWING CONDITIONS:
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision and DNA fees due on or before 04-03-2016.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Court does not object to Electronic monitoring and the Day Reporting Center.
*  MUST provide a DNA sample.
*  As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms or weapons.
*  Defendant shall not vote until civil rights are restored.

Received and filed with the court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form

Defendant Derek R Goral in court with attorney Bridget J. Krause.  Defendant Derek R Goral in custody.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for Paul Hauer for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found Defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.

Attorney Bridget Krause in court, defendant Derek R Goral not in court, in custody.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Scheduling conference scheduled for 04-03-2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Bridget Krause in court, defendant Derek R Goral not in court, in custody.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Scheduling conference scheduled for 02-26-2014 at 08:30 am.
Filed, State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Case is adjourned for Scheduling Conference on January 30, 2014 at 8:30 a.m. in Branch 26.

Defendant Derek R Goral in court with attorney Bridget Krause.  Defendant Derek R Goral in custody.  Danielle Chojnacki for Karen Ann Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Pocan, Br. 26.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring and Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Derek R Goral in court with attorney Bridget Krause.  Defendant Derek R Goral in custody.  Paul L Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
